title: Cwm Pennant Walking Route

images.title: David Medcalf / Cwm Pennant
images.caption: Cwm Pennant. This is one of the wonderful wild places of Wales. The hills in the background are the Nantlle Ridge.

images.title: Philip Halling / Bridge over Afon Dwyfor
images.caption: Bridge over Afon Dwyfor. Just below this bridge over Afon Dwyfor, this pool provides a refreshing dip after a hot day walking in the mountains above Cwm Pennant.

images.title: David Medcalf / Autumn bounty in Cwm Pennant
images.caption: Autumn bounty in Cwm Pennant. A wonderfully berried hawthorn bush.

images.title: David Medcalf / Farmland in Cwm Pennant
images.caption: Farmland in the valley.

images.title: John Gibson / Pennant Chapel
images.caption: Pennant Chapel. The little chapel in Cwm Pennant has a date stone for 1870. Although only an infrequent visitor, I can remember when this chapel had a congregation but it's now for sale, presumably for conversion into a habitation.

images.title: David Medcalf / The Old School, Llanfihangel-y-pennant
images.caption: The Old School, Llanfihangel-y-pennant

description: This circular walk explores the beautiful Cwm Pennant in the Snowdonia National Park. This stunning valley stretches from north of the villages of Dolbenmaen and Golan towards the Drwys y Coed pass, between Moel Hebog and Crib Nantlle. The walk starts at some roadside parking a few miles north east of Dolbenmaen. You can then follow a mixture of country lanes and footpaths through the area which includes lovely views of the Afon Dwyfor and the surrounding mountains of Snowdonia.
